translation.en: [reporter] Reality TV star Paris Hilton
translation.ko: 리얼리티 TV 스타 패리스 힐튼은 수요일에 미 의회에서

translation.en: embraced the spotlight on Capitol Hill, Wednesday,
translation.ko: 리얼리티 TV 스타 패리스 힐튼은 수요일에 미 의회에서 자신이 17세 때 유타주의 한 행동 치료 센터에서 겪은

translation.en: telling lawmakers about her personal experiences of trauma and abuse
translation.ko: 자신이 17세 때 유타주의 한 행동 치료 센터에서 겪은

translation.en: while at a behavioral treatment center in Utah when she was 17 years old.
I was strangled, slapped across the face,
watched in the shower by male staff.
translation.ko: 제가 샤워하는 걸 남자 직원이 지켜봤죠

translation.en: [man] This is happening in our country to our young people.
translation.ko: 우리 나라 청소년들에게 벌어지고 있는 일입니다 "2020년 9월, 패리스 힐튼 문제 청소년 산업 반대 운동 시작"

translation.en: And if it can happen to Paris Hilton and her family,
translation.ko: 패리스 힐튼과 그 가족에게 이런 일이 일어난다면

translation.en: think about all those people who can't be here today.
translation.ko: 이 자리에 설 수 없는 사람들은 어떨지 생각해 보십시오

translation.en: [woman] I went to sleep thinking I'd be going to school the next day.
translation.ko: 잠들 때까지만 해도 다음 날 학교에 갈 줄 알았죠 "1989년"

translation.en: I was 15.
The house was dark. My parents weren't there.
And I was woken up by two men standing over my bed.
translation.ko: 누가 절 깨웠고 침대맡에 두 남자가 서 있었어요

translation.en: They were big. They looked like mountain men.
translation.ko: 덩치가 컸어요 산에서 사는 사람들 같았죠

translation.en: They were like, "Get up. Get dressed. You're coming with us."
translation.ko: 그 사람들은 말했어요 '일어나서 옷 입고 따라와'

translation.en: [woman] They told me if I tried to run, they would handcuff me.
translation.ko: 도망치려고 하면 수갑을 채울 거라고 했어요

translation.en: They grabbed me and forcibly removed me from my house.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 절 붙잡고 집에서 강제로 끌고 나갔죠

translation.en: [woman] I was taken to the airport.
They had hired a private plane.
When we were on the flight, he's like, "Do you wanna know where you're going?"
translation.ko: 비행기에 타자 남자가 물었어요 '어디 가는지 알고 싶나?'

translation.en: I'm like, "Nope."
Because I didn't want them to know I was afraid.
[woman] I got in the car with a woman who called herself "Mad Cat"
translation.ko: 한 남자, 여자와 차에 탔는데 여자는 자칭 '미친 고양이'였고

translation.en: and a guy who called himself "Mad Dog."
And I remember being like, "What the fuck is this?"
[woman] They drove me into the middle of the desert.
translation.ko: 저를 실은 차는 사막 한가운데로 갔어요

translation.en: And then there's a fire in the distance.
And they handed me a note written on the back of an empty bill envelope.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 제게 메모가 적힌 빈 청구서 봉투를 줬어요

translation.en: "This is for the best. We love you."
And that's when I knew that my parents paid these people to kidnap me
translation.ko: 그때 알았죠 부모님이 이 사람들한테 돈을 주고 절 납치해 이 프로그램에 데려가라고 시켰다는 걸요

translation.en: and take me to the program.
translation.ko: 절 납치해 이 프로그램에 데려가라고 시켰다는 걸요

translation.en: [man] Let's go! This is it!
Come on, let's move!
Let's go!
Get out of that truck!
Let's go! Move!
Welcome to Challenger in the southern deserts.
translation.ko: 남부 사막의 챌린저 캠프에 온 걸 환영한다

translation.en: The next 63 days, you'll be under my care, my staff's care.
translation.ko: 너희는 앞으로 63일간 나와 교관들의 지도를 받게 될 것이다

translation.en: Do you understand?
-[teenagers] Yes, sir! -[man] I can't hear you!
[teenagers] Yes, sir!
How do you handle it when the child that you've loved and raised for 16 years
suddenly rebels and becomes someone you don't recognize anymore?
translation.ko: 완전히 딴사람이 돼버렸을 때 여러분은 어떻게 대처하시나요?

translation.en: [man 1] The '80s were a time when the world was changing.
There was a deep concern
that the youth of America was taking a wrong turn.
translation.ko: 잘못된 길로 가고 있다는 깊은 우려가 있었죠

translation.en: Nancy? Thank you.
Today, there's a drug and alcohol abuse epidemic in this country,
translation.ko: 오늘날 이 나라에는 마약과 알코올이 만연해 있고

translation.en: and no one is safe from it.
Not you, not me, and certainly not our children.
translation.ko: 여러분도, 저도 우리 아이들은 말할 것도 없죠

translation.en: [reporter 1] The country is facing a crisis in dealing with its children.
translation.ko: 미국 부모들은 자녀 문제로 골머리를 앓고 있습니다

translation.en: You know, it was, "What do you do?"
[reporter 2] When nothing else seems to work,
some desperate parents send their troubled teens
to these so-called "wilderness therapy camps."
translation.ko: 엇나가는 십 대 자녀들을 '야생 치료 캠프'란 곳에 보냅니다

translation.en: Designed, supposedly, to kick them out of their bad habits and rebellious ways.
translation.ko: 아이들이 나쁜 습관과 반항심을 버릴 수 있게 돕는 곳이죠

translation.en: [reporter 3] It is a brainchild of 35-year-old Steve Cartisano, a former Air Force sergeant.
translation.ko: 35세의 전 공군 병장 스티브 카티사노가 고안했습니다

translation.en: [Steve] So many people in our society today are giving kids excuses.
translation.ko: 요즘 우리 사회는 아이들을 너무 많이 봐줘요

translation.en: Kids need to learn this valuable lesson that they are responsible for their lives and accountable for their actions.
translation.ko: 아이들은 자신의 삶과 행동에 책임이 있다는 걸 배워야 합니다

translation.en: [man 2] Steve Cartisano was a genius.
Such a colorful character
who knew all about how to fix all the problems in your family
translation.ko: 그냥 전화 한 통으로 모든 집안 문제를 해결할 방법을 알고 있었죠

translation.en: with just a simple phone call.
translation.ko: 모든 집안 문제를 해결할 방법을 알고 있었죠

translation.en: The thing about Steve was people either loved him or despised him.
[woman] I think he was ahead of his time. He had this great idea.
translation.ko: 아빠는 시대를 앞서갔어요 기발한 생각을 해냈죠

translation.en: [reporter] It's called The Challenger Foundation.
It claims to transform bad kids through ordeal.
translation.ko: 시련을 통해 불량 청소년들을 변화시킨다고 주장하죠

translation.en: And then I think it got too big too quick.
translation.ko: 너무 빨리, 너무 커진 것 같아요

translation.en: [reporter] The kids are worn down until they're good again.
translation.ko: 다시 착한 어린이가 될 때까지 한계에 몰립니다

translation.en: [man 1] The concept behind it was excellent,
and the core of what he did was quite remarkable.
translation.ko: 그 이면의 취지는 훌륭했어요 스티브가 한 일의 핵심은 정말 획기적이었죠

translation.en: That's not what I do or my staff does. It's Mother Nature, Phil.
translation.ko: 저나 직원들이 하는 게 아니라 대자연이 하는 거예요

translation.en: [man 1] It still lives today.
[woman] This industry has just grown.
[reporter] The trouble is some of the teens are not coming back.
translation.ko: 문제는 돌아오지 않는 아이들도 있다는 것입니다

translation.en: Teenagers find themselves in brutal conditions
far beyond the reach of US authorities.
translation.ko: 혹독한 환경에 처한 자신을 발견하게 됩니다

translation.en: When is it survival and discipline, and when is it abuse?
-It was bad. -[man 2] Death and abuse.
His business became a total disaster,
but he would rise from the ashes,
translation.ko: 하지만 그는 잿더미 속에서 다시 일어났습니다

translation.en: like, "Never say die."
[Phil Donahue] All right, Mr. Cartisano,
we're talking about your Challenger Foundation.
translation.ko: 카티사노 씨의 챌린저 재단에 대해 얘기하고 있습니다

translation.en: Is your kid talking back to you?
Have you got a smart-ass on your hands at home?
translation.ko: 집에 감당 안 되는 건방진 녀석이 있습니까?

translation.en: [Phil] What do you wanna do with these kids?
Who can kidnap whom?
Who is watching these people
translation.ko: 여러분의 자녀를 바른길로 인도한다고 하는 이들은

translation.en: who are presuming to straighten your children out?
translation.ko: 여러분의 자녀를 바른길로 인도한다고 하는 이들은 누가 감시하죠?

translation.en: And how much of this…
[man 2] Steve Cartisano launches Challenger in 1988.
They basically take kids out of their beds in the middle of the night.
translation.ko: 기본적으로 한밤중에 아이들을 침대에서 끌어내죠 "크리스 스미스 - 기자"

translation.en: The parents have signed away their parental rights.
Where are the kids' rights in this deal? There are 16-year-old-kids--
translation.ko: 이 거래에서 아이들의 권리는 어디 있나요? 16살짜리 아이들이…

translation.en: The kids are having the rights when they're not going to school,
translation.ko: 그 잘난 권리를 가진 아이들은 학교에 안 가고

translation.en: and they're using drugs, and they're being real jerks.
translation.ko: 마약을 하고 진짜 머저리가 돼 가고 있죠

translation.en: They're introduced to a big, burly guy who says, "I own you now,
translation.ko: 그리고 아이들은 이렇게 말하는 거구를 만나게 돼요 '지금부터 넌 내 소유고'

translation.en: and you're gonna go on a 500-mile forced hike across the Utah desert."
translation.ko: '넌 유타 사막을 가로질러 800km를 걷게 될 거야'

translation.en: My name is Horsehair.
Anything and everything your staff tells you, you will do. No hesitation.
translation.ko: 너희는 교관이 시키는 건 머뭇거리지 말고 뭐든 한다

translation.en: Is that clear?
[teenagers] Yes, sir.
-[Horsehair] Is that clear? -[teenagers] Yes, sir!
[Horsehair] Tell me your name, your age, where you're from.
April Schmidt, 15.
-[Horsehair] Speak up. -Bonney Lake, Washington.
[louder] April Schmidt, 15. Bonney Lake, Washington.
[Chris] That first day, kids would realize they're in a whole different world
translation.ko: 첫날, 아이들은 자신들이 전혀 다른 세상에

translation.en: than where they came from.
[Horsehair] Better start treating your own mother better than you have been, right?
translation.ko: 앞으로는 어머니 말씀을 더 잘 듣는 게 좋을 거야, 알겠나?

translation.en: Yes, sir.
[Horsehair] This is not a temporary thing.
She sacrificed a lot for you. Do you understand what that means?
translation.ko: 널 위해 많은 걸 희생하셨어 그게 무슨 뜻인지 아나?

translation.en: Yes, sir.
Too late to cry about it now. You should've thought about that when you were dealing with her, right?
translation.ko: 이제 와서 울어봤자 소용없어 진작 잘했어야지, 안 그래?

translation.en: Yes, sir.
[Horsehair] You better make it a permanent fix.
translation.ko: 앞으로 쭉 잘하는 게 좋을 거야

translation.en: Is that clear? Yes, sir.
[Horsehair] We broke 'em down.
But we didn't break 'em down to hurt 'em. We didn't break 'em down to punish them.
translation.ko: 하지만 다치게 하거나 벌주려고 그런 게 아니에요

translation.en: We were breaking them down to get rid of all the old crap
translation.ko: "랜스 '호스헤어' 재거 챌린저 현장 지도자" 과거의 나쁜 습관을 모두 없애고 새로워지게 하려고 그런 거죠

translation.en: and to rebuild.
translation.ko: 과거의 나쁜 습관을 모두 없애고 새로워지게 하려고 그런 거죠

translation.en: Help them to be a better, more positive person.
translation.ko: 과거의 나쁜 습관을 모두 없애고 새로워지게 하려고 그런 거죠 더 긍정적이고 나은 사람이 되도록 도와준 거예요

translation.en: [Horsehair] Some of the kids were so scared, they'd almost pass out,
translation.ko: 겁에 질려 기절 직전인 아이들도 있었지만

translation.en: and that was fine by me
because I wanted them to have a little fear.
Um, a lot of these kids, this was it, or they were going to jail.
translation.ko: 이게 아니면 감옥에 갈 아이들이 대다수였어요

translation.en: [Steve] Kids aren't going to be happy to be here. They're going to be hungry.
translation.ko: 아이들은 이곳 생활이 좋지 않을 거예요 아이들은 굶주리고 피곤하고 더러워질 겁니다

translation.en: They're going to be tired, going to be dirty.
We have to do things that work.
Talking to 'em and just loving them won't get them to change their minds.
translation.ko: 대화와 사랑만으로는 아이들의 마음을 돌릴 수 없습니다

translation.en: Are you all listening to me?
[teenagers] Yes, sir!
Steve Cartisano was in the Air Force. I was in the Air Force.
translation.ko: 스티브와 저는 둘 다 공군 출신이었어요

translation.en: So when we met, we had that in common.
translation.ko: 그래서 만났을 때 통하는 게 있었죠

translation.en: He felt that the youth needed some sort of different way to help them.
translation.ko: 스티브는 청소년을 도울 다른 방법이 필요하다고 했어요

translation.en: We were way ahead of our time.
[Horsehair] It was a 63-day program,
and we had three different sections.
We took 'em to that very bottom level first.
translation.ko: "티피 - 손수레 - 원시" 일단 가장 낮은 1단계 구역으로 데려갔죠

translation.en: We gave 'em what they need, but that wasn't free.
translation.ko: 아이들에게 필요한 걸 줬지만 공짜는 아니었어요

translation.en: There was a cost to everything.
We provided 'em food, but the food was at a different location.
translation.ko: 음식을 주기는 했지만 다른 장소에 갖다 놨어요

translation.en: They had to travel on foot to get there.
We weren't punishing anyone.
There are consequences, both good and bad, for our actions.
translation.ko: 행동에 따른 좋은 결과와 나쁜 결과가 있었을 뿐이죠

translation.en: You determine whether it's a negative or positive consequence.
translation.ko: 긍정적인 결과와 부정적인 결과를 결정짓는 건 자신이에요

translation.en: [Steve] We're not talking about kids that are going to church on Sunday
translation.ko: 하나 아셔야 하는 게 지금 우리는 일요일에 교회에 가고

translation.en: or that are going to youth dances during the middle of the week.
translation.ko: 주중에 청소년 댄스파티에 가는 아이들을 말하는 게 아니에요

translation.en: We're talking about kids, for the most part,
translation.ko: 우리가 말하는 아이들은 대부분 통제 불능에 폭력적이고

translation.en: that are out of control, that are violent, that are going to seduce your children,
translation.ko: 우리가 말하는 아이들은 대부분 통제 불능에 폭력적이고 다른 아이들을 유혹해 마약을 주고

translation.en: give them drugs, and steal your car and your jewelry if they can.
translation.ko: 다른 아이들을 유혹해 마약을 주고 차나 보석도 훔칠 수도 있는 그런 아이들이에요

translation.en: They're here because they're manipulators,
translation.ko: 조종에 능한 아이들이라 여기 온 거예요

translation.en: and they've learned how to work the system.
[Nadine] I've always been a rabble-rouser, black sheep of the family.
translation.ko: 전 항상 문제를 일으키는 집안의 골칫거리였어요 "네이딘 - 15세, 1989년 8월 챌린저 캠프 입소"

translation.en: You know, as a kid with no power, the only power you have is your behavior.
So I would… Yeah, I would act out a bit.
Like, I would drink, and I would go to parties.
I loved to smoke pot.
So I was a bit of a stoner. That could worry someone.
translation.ko: 전 마리화나를 상습적으로 피웠고 그런 제가 걱정스러웠겠죠

translation.en: I had a boyfriend,
and he was noted as sort of a troublemaker in town.
My parents didn't like me dating him, and my mom didn't like me.
translation.ko: 부모님은 제가 그 애 만나는 걸 싫어하셨고 엄마는 저를 싫어하셨어요

translation.en: So, like, she was trying to find a way to get rid of me since I was 12.
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 12살 때부터 절 없앨 방법을 찾으셨죠

translation.en: So I packed my shit and ran away.
I was at my boyfriend's sister's house, hiding, when the police came.
translation.ko: 경찰이 왔을 때 전 남친 누나 집에 숨어 있었어요

translation.en: The police sent me home with my parents.
translation.ko: 경찰은 절 부모님과 함께 집으로 돌려보냈어요

translation.en: Um, but they didn't tell me where I was going after.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 후 어디로 가게 될지는 말해주지 않았죠

translation.en: [Nadine] I slept on the ground, no tent, nothing. Like, it was rocky.
translation.ko: 텐트고 뭐고 아무것도 없는 바닥에서 잤어요 바위투성이였죠

translation.en: [Horsehair] Come on! Get up! This isn't summer camp. This is it. Come on, let's go!
translation.ko: 기상, 이건 여름 캠프가 아니다 다 일어나, 출발한다!

translation.en: [Nadine] In the morning, there's, like, a bunch of kids.
I mean, skinny, shirts were ripped, and a girl came up to me,
translation.ko: 다 깡마르고 찢어진 셔츠를 입고 있었죠 한 여자애가 제게 다가왔어요

translation.en: and I was chewing gum, and she asked if she could have it.
translation.ko: 제가 껌을 씹고 있었는데 그걸 달라고 했죠

translation.en: She wanted the gum that I was chewing. I'm like, "It has no flavor."
translation.ko: 제가 씹던 껌을요 단물이 다 빠졌다고 했더니 상관없다는 거예요

translation.en: She's like, "I don't care." And I'm like, "Okay."
translation.ko: 단물이 다 빠졌다고 했더니 상관없다는 거예요 그래서 '알겠어' 하고 줬죠

translation.en: And then another kid asked me for my soup,
translation.ko: 그러자 다른 애가 와서 수프를 달라고 했어요

translation.en: and I was gonna give him my soup.
And then a girl said, "Don't give him your soup."
translation.ko: 한 여자애가 말했죠 '걔한테 수프 주지 마'

translation.en: "You need your soup." I'm like, "Okay."
[Nadine] It was like 113 degrees,
and I hiked, like, 500 miles in tennis shoes.
It was basically just surviving.
Keep walking. Here.
-Thank you. -Just keep walking.
At each stage, life got a little better.
The second group, we had a handcart,
and so they could put all their gear into the cart, but they all had to push it.
translation.ko: 짐을 수레에 실을 수 있었지만 아이들이 직접 밀어야 했어요

translation.en: And our third group, we brought a butter churn out to them. We brought a Dutch oven.
translation.ko: 세 번째 그룹에게는 버터 제조기와 압력솥을 줬죠

translation.en: [Kinney] Given everything that was going on in my life at that point in time,
translation.ko: "키니 - 13세, 1988년 8월 챌린저 캠프 입소" 그때의 제 삶을 생각하면

translation.en: I didn't mind that it was hard and dusty and dirty
translation.ko: 힘들고 먼지가 많고 더럽고 고약한 냄새가 나는 건

translation.en: and that we all smelled terrible. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 힘들고 먼지가 많고 더럽고 고약한 냄새가 나는 건 저한테 별거 아니었어요

translation.en: [Horsehair] Here, we've been practicing the balance of things.
translation.ko: 우린 이곳에서 균형을 이루는 훈련을 했다

translation.en: There's a spirit in all this that we do.
translation.ko: 우리가 하는 모든 일엔 정신이 담겨 있지

translation.en: It's always been that way from the very beginning of time.
[Kinney] Living at home was hard.
My mother and I were constantly arguing. I was not doing well in school.
translation.ko: 엄마와 저는 끊임없이 싸웠죠 학교생활도 잘 못했어요, 그러다가

translation.en: And then, in the month after my father passed away,
translation.ko: 학교생활도 잘 못했어요, 그러다가 아버지가 돌아가시고 한 달쯤 뒤에 제가

translation.en: I did attempt
translation.ko: 아버지가 돌아가시고 한 달쯤 뒤에 제가

translation.en: taking my own life.
[Horsehair] Okay. Everybody, gather around over here. Make a horseshoe shape.
translation.ko: 다들 이쪽으로 와서 말굽 모양으로 모여

translation.en: [Kinney] This felt different. There was a different energy about the group.
translation.ko: 느낌이 달랐어요 그 속에서는 다른 에너지가 느껴졌고

translation.en: There wasn't a lot of time to really think about my life.
translation.ko: 제 삶에 관해 생각할 시간이 별로 없었죠

translation.en: I was purely in survival mode at that point in time.
That was comforting for me.
[Horsehair] Our Father in heaven, we ask you to help us at this time
translation.ko: 하늘에 계신 우리 아버지 이 시간 우리를 도우시고

translation.en: be mindful of the sacrifice that this animal is representing to us.
translation.ko: 이 동물의 희생을 기억하게 해 주시옵소서

translation.en: We say this in the name of Jesus Christ. Amen.
-[teenager] Oh, amen. -[all] Amen.
[Kinney] I thrived.
I really… I really enjoyed being there.
[Horsehair] We're going to show you different ways of cooking.
One is the pit. We're gonna use the stomach to cook.
translation.ko: 하나는 구덩이를 파는 건데 위를 가지고 요리할 거야

translation.en: Get ready to stir it. Get the meat in there.
I was asked one time, "How do you know when they're ready to go home?"
translation.ko: 한번은 이런 질문을 받았죠 '애들이 집에 돌아갈 준비가 된 걸 어떻게 알죠?'

translation.en: It was their look. It was their countenance.
They had sparkle in their eye.
They had smiles on their face that you couldn't take away.
translation.ko: 얼굴엔 절대 지울 수 없는 미소를 띠죠

translation.en: I think… I think most teenagers should come here and improve yourself,
translation.ko: 십 대는 거의 다 여기에 와서 자신을 발전시켜야 해요

translation.en: and this is probably gonna be the best thing that happened to you.
translation.ko: 십 대는 거의 다 여기에 와서 자신을 발전시켜야 해요 아마 인생 최고의 경험이 될 거예요

translation.en: Steve had a vision that everyone needs a rite of passage
translation.ko: 스티브는 누구에게나 통과 의례가 필요하다고 믿었어요

translation.en: from childhood to adulthood,
translation.ko: 스티브는 누구에게나 통과 의례가 필요하다고 믿었어요 어린 시절에서 성인으로 넘어가는 통과 의례요

translation.en: and it usually encompasses…
something that's very difficult.
It just hurts, you know?
I just…
I pushed my mom away, and I pushed my dad away.
She wrote me this letter telling me how much she loved me and missed me
translation.ko: 엄마가 편지를 보냈는데 절 너무 사랑하고 보고 싶고 제가 집에 돌아오기를 바란대요

translation.en: and wanted me to come home,
translation.ko: 절 너무 사랑하고 보고 싶고 제가 집에 돌아오기를 바란대요

translation.en: but I need to be here.
If I did go home early, it wouldn't, you know…
All this effort that… that's gone into…
translation.ko: 절 변화시키기 위해 들인 이 모든 노력이

translation.en: changing me would be just a complete waste.
They were going through a rite of passage, and, um, this was the beginning of that.
translation.ko: 그 아이들은 통과 의례를 거치는 중이었고 이게 그 시작이었죠

translation.en: How many of you were glad to be here the first minute you got off and arrived?
translation.ko: 여기 도착하자마자 좋아한 사람이 몇이나 되지?

translation.en: One, two. How many of you are glad to be here now?
translation.ko: 하나, 둘 지금은 몇 명이나 좋지?

translation.en: [teenager] Yeah.
How many of you have learned something about yourself that you didn't know when you got here?
translation.ko: 여기 오기 전엔 몰랐던 자신에 관해 알게 된 사람은?

translation.en: And it's hard to explain to somebody who doesn't understand it.
I felt accomplished.
At the end of every single day, I felt accomplished.
translation.ko: 매일 하루가 끝날 때마다 성취감을 느꼈죠

translation.en: [Steve] We're made better by struggle, trial, and adversity.
translation.ko: 우린 투쟁과 시련 역경을 통해 더 나아집니다

translation.en: It's a simple equation.
We've had over 700 kids in the program. We've turned around hundreds of lives.
translation.ko: 700여 명이 프로그램에 참여했고 그중 수백 명의 인생을 바꿨습니다

translation.en: These kids need this. We're saving so many more lives.
translation.ko: 이 아이들에겐 이게 필요해요 우린 더 많은 생명을 구하고 있죠

translation.en: [woman] Matthew would have been in juvenile detention or dead
translation.ko: "매슈 - 15세, 1990년 6월 챌린저 캠프 입소" 우리가 계속해서 뭔가를 하지 않았다면

translation.en: if we had not continued to try to do something.
Sorry.
[Matthew] I drank a lot. I smoked a lot of pot.
Every so often, I used to munch a hit of LSD.
Or I'd smoke a little bit of PCP.
There's a bridge down the street,
and he actually used to go and jump off onto the trains.
translation.ko: 실제로 거기서 기차 위로 뛰어내리곤 했어요

translation.en: [woman] He was running wild.
-[Matthew] I had a good time. [laughs] -[camera clicking]
[Matthew] But at the same time, I was constantly getting arrested
for drug possession or something like that.
I believe I was a bit of a nightmare.
At this point, the police were here a lot with Matthew.
translation.ko: 그땐 경찰이 매슈를 데리고 자주 왔어요

translation.en: They would pick him up. Maybe he'd gotten some alcohol somewhere.
translation.ko: 어디서 술 마시고 있는 걸 데리고 왔죠 "카리 - 매슈의 어머니"

translation.en: Whether it was me, his father, the school, the police,
whatever the punishment was, it really just didn't matter.
translation.ko: 어떤 벌을 줘도 씨알도 안 먹혔죠

translation.en: At that point, it was think outside the box.
[Steve] We're talking about kids in a crack house, or they're running away,
translation.ko: 지금 우리가 말하는 아이들은 마약과 가출을 일삼고

translation.en: they're out of control, and they are master manipulators.
-They're blaming everybody else-- -[Phil] Master manipulators.
translation.ko: - 전부 남 탓을 하고… - 조종의 달인이요

translation.en: [Steve] When they're 25, all the excuses of why they quit high school
translation.ko: 이 아이들이 25살이 되면 왜 고등학교를 중퇴했고

translation.en: or why they were doing drugs aren't gonna matter, Phil.
translation.ko: 왜 마약에 손대게 됐는지 그 어떤 변명도 통하지 않죠

translation.en: I thought, "You know what? I don't know what else to try,
translation.ko: 전 생각했죠 '뭘 더 해야 할지 모르겠는데 괜찮은 방법 같네'

translation.en: but this sounds good."
translation.ko: '뭘 더 해야 할지 모르겠는데 괜찮은 방법 같네'

translation.en: I had only been there… I had… I had not been there that long,
translation.ko: 거기 간 지 얼마 되지도 않았는데

translation.en: but I wanted so much to get back to my McDonald's at home.
translation.ko: 집에 가서 맥도날드 음식을 먹고 싶어 죽는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: And my Oreos.
And my… my Round Top ice cream.
My good stuff.
But the adults had already made the decision,
so I thought to myself, "Just face it, man."
"You're here. Do the program."
"Then you'll be out of here and you can go have a beer."
I was just afraid I would not be able to get back for a long time,
translation.ko: 오랫동안 못 돌아갈까 봐 그게 겁나긴 했지만

translation.en: but I thought, "They can't kill me."
translation.ko: 이렇게 생각했어요 '저 사람들은 날 못 죽여'

translation.en: That's exactly what I thought. "They can't kill me."
translation.ko: 딱 그 생각을 했죠 '저 사람들은 날 못 죽여'

translation.en: Tonight, a man who says,
"Stop the coddling and skip the psychiatrist."
Instead, give teens a simple message.
Shape up. Life's not a picnic. So take a survival course.
translation.ko: '정신 차려, 인생은 소풍이 아냐 그러니 죽기 살기로 덤벼'

translation.en: -[camera clicking] -[woman] Steve's responsibility was the entire program,
which meant the advertisement, the sales over the phone,
translation.ko: 즉, 광고 "챌린저 재단 우리는 결과를 냅니다" 전화 판촉

translation.en: managing the finances of the company and the employees of the company.
And it grew a lot faster than he expected.
translation.ko: 사업은 그이의 예상보다 훨씬 빨리 성장했어요

translation.en: So he was very dependent on the people in southern Utah
translation.ko: "데비 카티사노 스티브의 전 아내" 그래서 유타주 남부에서 프로그램을 운영하는 사람들을

translation.en: who were running the program there.
I thought we got too big too fast, and I don't think we were ready for it.
translation.ko: 너무 빨리, 너무 커지는 바람에 준비가 안 돼 있었던 것 같아요

translation.en: [reporter] They have no showers, no toilets, no bunks or dining hall.
translation.ko: 이들은 샤워실도, 화장실도 침대나 식당도 없습니다

translation.en: Some of the staff were… Honestly, they were fillers.
translation.ko: 솔직히 머릿수만 채우려고 데려다 놓은 직원들도 있었어요

translation.en: [reporter] Their beds are blankets on the ground.
They wanted to help, um, but they didn't have the same understanding as we did.
translation.ko: 그 직원들은 돕고 싶어도 우리 같은 지식이 없어서 도울 수 없었죠

translation.en: [reporter] The kids will be held accountable for their actions.
translation.ko: 아이들은 자신의 행동에 책임져야 할 것입니다

translation.en: Share your food with a hungry friend, you'll both go without.
translation.ko: 배고픈 친구와 음식을 나누면 둘 다 굶어야 하고

translation.en: Steal food, you'll be tied hand and foot.
So the staff were very young, most of them.
And then there was also Horsehair, who was the field leader.
The problem is, he believed in Steve Cartisano.
So Steve Cartisano called us manipulators, liars.
translation.ko: 스티브 카티사노는 우리를 조종과 거짓말의 달인이라고 했죠

translation.en: So that was sort of… What was ingrained in the staff was to not believe us.
translation.ko: 그래서 직원들에게는 우리를 믿어선 안 된다는 생각이 뿌리박혀 있었어요

translation.en: You know, some kids will say, "I have, uh, you know, a bad back."
translation.ko: 어떤 애들은 이럴 거예요 '나 허리가 안 좋아요'

translation.en: And, uh… Or, "My knee hurts." You look in the medical report.
translation.ko: '나 무릎이 아파요' 그런데 의료 기록을 보면 허리나 무릎을 다친 적이 없어요

translation.en: They've never hurt their knee. They've never had a bad back.
translation.ko: 그런데 의료 기록을 보면 허리나 무릎을 다친 적이 없어요

translation.en: So whenever you say you're sick, they call you a liar.
[Nadine] Basically, they were withholding… everything from us.
[reporter] If your attitude isn't right,
you'll stay here beyond 63 days until it is.
The longer we were there, the more it became like Lord of the Flies.
Like, we would tie our hair up with tampons 'cause of the string.
translation.ko: 우린 머리끈이 없어서 탐폰 줄로 머리를 묶었어요

translation.en: Sometimes, kids wouldn't roll their packs well,
so they'd fall apart on a trail,
translation.ko: 물건이 길 위로 쏟아질 때가 있었는데

translation.en: and then they'd get a rock for not packing their pack correctly.
translation.ko: 그럼 가방을 제대로 못 쌌다며 돌덩이를 얹어 줬죠

translation.en: [crying] I could move so much faster without this stupid rock.
translation.ko: 이 망할 돌덩이만 없으면 더 빨리 갈 수 있어

translation.en: [Nadine] You'd use your T-shirt as toilet paper, because you didn't get toilet paper.
Can you imagine if you were hiking through the desert
and you came upon a bunch of dirty kids with tampons in their hair?
You'd be like, "What the fuck?"
[Matthew] I didn't wanna live in the desert anymore.
This one morning, I just refused to get up.
translation.ko: 어느 날 아침 전 안 일어나겠다고 했죠

translation.en: I think the counselors told me I had to get up.
I said, "No." They said, "Get up!"
translation.ko: 전 싫다고 했고 그들은 일어나라고 소리쳤죠

translation.en: I said, "No."
"You're not gonna force me up."
And he hit me.
He literally hit me.
There was another counselor.
That counselor told him to tie my feet together at the ankles,
translation.ko: 그 사람이 제 두 발을 묶으라고 했고

translation.en: and he started dragging me. And, yep, that hurt.
translation.ko: 절 끌고 가기 시작했어요 네, 아팠죠

translation.en: But after only ten feet or so, he stopped.
He said, "Now, are you ready to hike?"
And I… I was in pain.
[Matthew] And so he kept dragging me.
The skin was scraped off of my back.
Every 40 or 50 feet, he'd stop and he'd say, "Are you ready to hike?"
translation.ko: 10m쯤 갈 때마다 멈춰서 물어봤죠 '걸을 준비 됐나?'

translation.en: I kept saying, "No."
[Matthew] "You are not gonna make me hike."
[Matthew] Steve Cartisano did come out the next morning.
translation.ko: 다음 날 아침 스티브 카티사노가 왔어요

translation.en: He told me to remember that it was my fault that had happened,
translation.ko: 이런 일이 생긴 건 내 잘못이란 걸 명심하라고 했죠

translation.en: and then he left.
[Matthew] I thought, "You're supposed to be counselors."
"You're supposed to be my advocates, and you're beating me like this."
translation.ko: '내 편이 돼 줘야 하는 사람들이 이렇게 두들겨 패네'

translation.en: "Who can I trust now?"
[man] I was notified by state social services
that they had removed a young man from The Challenger program
and that he had injuries that I needed to be aware of.
translation.ko: 그 아이에게 제가 알아야 할 부상이 있다고 했어요

translation.en: My first encounter with the program was, I believe, in early 1990.
translation.ko: 제가 이 프로그램을 처음 접한 건 1990년대 초였을 거예요 "맥스 잭슨 유타주 케인 카운티 전 보안관"

translation.en: State officials let us know that they were taking kids
with all different kinds of problems,
translation.ko: 한 단체가 온갖 문제아들을 모아놨다고 했어요

translation.en: kids that were dealing drugs and into drugs,
and putting them with kids who were just sedentary couch potatoes
translation.ko: 마약을 거래하거나 마약에 빠진 애들과 종일 꼼짝도 안 하고 소파에 앉아 있는 애들을 모아서

translation.en: and put 'em out here in the harsh desert,
and they weren't allowing law enforcement access to them.
translation.ko: 그리고 그들에게는 경찰의 접근이 허용되지 않는다고 했죠

translation.en: I just kind of locked that away in my memory
in case I had to deal with the program in the future myself.
translation.ko: 혹시 그 프로그램과 관련된 일이 생길까 봐요

translation.en: [Max] I drove up to the hospital,
and went in, was shocked to see this young man, Matthew,
translation.ko: 병실에 들어가서 매슈라는 아이의 상태를 보고

translation.en: in the state that he was.
[Max] He'd been examined by one of the local doctors.
He said, "This kid's emaciated."
The doctor had counted over 80 scars, marks, and contusions
on his, uh, back and upper torso
that he had incurred while being dragged through the desert.
And he told me that the wounds were in various stages of healing
translation.ko: 의사는 상처가 여러 단계로 낫고 있고

translation.en: and, uh, that he was being abused by staff members of the program.
[interviewer] How did you feel when you found out?
translation.ko: 그런 일이 있었다는 걸 알았을 때 기분이 어떠셨어요?

translation.en: I was upset. I was mad, 'cause I told the staff,
translation.ko: 당황스럽고 화가 났죠 제가 그 직원한테 말했거든요

translation.en: "If you hurt a kid or abuse a kid out here,
you'll have to deal with me. I'll deal with you."
I mean, some of how we did things could look abusive.
translation.ko: 물론 우리가 한 일의 일부는 학대로 보였을 수 있어요

translation.en: Better start treating your mother better than you have been.
translation.ko: 앞으로는 어머니 말씀을 더 잘 듣는 게 좋을 거야

translation.en: There's a fine line in some of it.
I don't think anybody should be beat up, but I think…
But there is a time and a place and room for what I consider corporal punishment.
translation.ko: 하지만 체벌이 필요한 때와 장소, 상황이 있어요

translation.en: A spanking, you know? A good spanking sometimes can do wonders.
translation.ko: 엉덩이 때리기 같은 거요 그게 놀라운 결과를 낳기도 하죠

translation.en: -[Horsehair] You understand? -[teenagers] Yes, sir.
-[Horsehair] I can't hear you! -[teenagers] Yes, sir!
I'm sorry, I might be old school, but human nature is we need parameters.
translation.ko: 죄송해요 제가 구식인지는 모르겠지만 인간 본성에는 경계나 규칙이 필요해요

translation.en: Otherwise, we have anarchy, and anarchy does not work.
translation.ko: 그렇지 않으면 난장판이 되고 그럼 작동하지 않죠

translation.en: Never has, never will.
[Kari] Someone from the program called me to tell me they had taken Matthew to the hospital,
translation.ko: 프로그램 관계자가 전화로 매슈를 병원에 데려갔다고 했어요

translation.en: and I thought, "Well, he's…
He's in the hospital's care, so he's okay."
So I flew out. Some people from Challenger picked me up.
translation.ko: 전 바로 날아갔죠 챌린저 사람들이 마중을 나왔고

translation.en: They paid for a hotel.
But once I saw Matthew, that was it. We were headed home.
translation.ko: 하지만 매슈를 본 순간 끝이었어요 우린 곧장 집으로 왔죠

translation.en: [Nadine] I understood it was an unsafe situation, like, from the very start.
translation.ko: 전 처음부터 안전하지 않은 상황인 걸 알았어요

translation.en: The hardest thing about being there?
Knowing my parents did it to me.
The program cost my parents over $16,000 in 1989.
So I don't… I mean, that's a lot of money in 1989.
[reporter] Over the past three years,
Cartisano says nearly 800 kids have gone through this program,
translation.ko: 약 800명의 청소년이 이 프로그램을 거쳐 갔고

translation.en: which translates into nearly $10 million.
translation.ko: 이를 금액으로 환산하면 무려 천만 달러에 육박합니다

translation.en: [Horsehair] Steve was smart. He knew that it took a lot of money.
translation.ko: 스티브는 똑똑했어요 그게 엄청난 돈이 될 걸 알았죠

translation.en: Why should we fault anybody that owns a business to make money?
translation.ko: 돈 벌려고 사업하는 사람이 비난받을 이유는 없잖아요

translation.en: He made a lot of money.
He goes out. He buys a big, beautiful home.
translation.ko: 스티브는 밖으로 나갔어요 크고 아름다운 집을 샀죠

translation.en: I got a radio!
He would rent cars. He rented a Lamborghini at one time.
translation.ko: 차 여러 대를 렌트했어요 람보르기니를 렌트한 적도 있었죠

translation.en: This goes completely against the grain of, like, "We're just trying to help kids."
translation.ko: 이건 그의 말과 완전히 상반돼요 자기들은 그저 아이들을 도우려는 거라더니

translation.en: You know?
This was very lavish.
[Debbie] I wasn't involved in the finances.
[Debbie] I just know that we had an adequate income,
uh, and so there was a lot of money coming in, I think,
but there was also a lot of money going out.
It was very expensive to run these programs.
translation.ko: 프로그램을 운영하는 데 돈이 많이 들었거든요

translation.en: [Debbie] We found this house in Utah.
It was a big house, about 6,500 square feet.
What do you think, Jen?
[Debbie] I bought a horse, and I started riding.
So things were really good, and it seemed to be a great success.
translation.ko: 모든 게 잘 풀렸고 큰 성공을 거둔 것 같았어요

translation.en: That's where I think he started losing focus.
translation.ko: 그때부터 스티브가 다른 데 눈을 돌린 것 같아요

translation.en: That mountain's called the "Fiftymile Mountain."
It runs 50 miles all the way to Lake Powell.
It's also the Kaiparowits Plateau.
This was a really bad place for the kids to be hiking in.
This landscape can turn deadly very fast.
translation.ko: 이 풍경은 순식간에 치명적으로 변할 수 있거든요

translation.en: [Max] I was driving with another sheriff…
translation.ko: 다른 보안관과 차를 타고 가고 있었는데

translation.en: when we got the call from Richfield dispatch
that a, uh, participant in the Challenger Foundation, female,
was en route to the Panguitch hospital.
[Horsehair] While I was in Provo at the office,
we got a call from other camps down here that there was an incident.
translation.ko: 이곳의 다른 캠프에서 사고가 났다는 연락을 받았어요

translation.en: So Steve grabbed the phone to ask what was happening,
translation.ko: 스티브는 수화기를 들고 무슨 일이냐고 물었고

translation.en: and his demeanor changed.
It was pretty serious.
We immediately dropped everything.
translation.ko: 우린 그 즉시 모든 일을 중단하고

translation.en: Him and I flew down.
We didn't know how bad she was.
We just knew that it was a serious thing.
[Horsehair] And we landed right in front of an ambulance.
They were doing CPR on her, and they had her hooked up.
translation.ko: 의료진은 CPR을 하고 있었고 여러 장비가 연결돼 있었죠

translation.en: A physician assistant, he looked at her,
and it wasn't even 45 seconds, and he called it. He said, "She's gone."
Steve was devastated by that.
translation.ko: 스티브는 그 일로 큰 충격을 받았어요

translation.en: He was very devastated by that.
I'm sure there was a part of him that saw it as his fault
translation.ko: 스티브는 분명 자기 잘못도 있다고 생각했을 거예요

translation.en: because it was his program,
and, uh, he was the one bringing children into the program,
but he also knew that it was beyond his control.
translation.ko: 하지만 자기 손을 떠난 일이었다는 것도 알았어요

translation.en: He did not spend that much time in southern Utah, really, at that point,
translation.ko: 당시에는 유타 남부에 있는 시간이 거의 없었거든요

translation.en: you know, so I think he realized
that there was nothing he could have done, really,
translation.ko: 결과를 바꿀 만한 그 어떤 일도 할 수 없었다는 걸

translation.en: that could have changed the outcome.
[reporter] Kristen Chase had spent just three days
translation.ko: 크리스틴 체이스는 험준한 카이파로위츠 고원에서 단 3일을 보냈습니다

translation.en: on the rugged Kaiparowits Plateau.
She collapsed and died after completing a five-mile day hike.
translation.ko: 그러다 하루에 8km를 걸은 후 쓰러져 사망했습니다

translation.en: I want you to meet Sharon Fuqua.
Sharon had decided to send their daughter Kristen to a wilderness camp
translation.ko: 샤론 씨는 딸인 크리스틴이 10학년 시험에서 낙제하고 항우울제를 과다 복용 해

translation.en: after she was failing the 10th grade and overdosing on antidepressants.
translation.ko: 10학년 시험에서 낙제하고 항우울제를 과다 복용 해 야생 캠프에 보내기로 결정했습니다

translation.en: She was 16 years old at the time.
Sharon, of course, had no way of knowing
that she'd never see her only daughter alive again.
translation.ko: 다시는 못 볼 거란 걸 알 길이 없었죠

translation.en: -[David] She looks mischievous. -Yes, she was. [laughs]
translation.ko: - 장난꾸러기 같네요 - 응, 그랬어 "샤론 & 데이비드 크리스틴의 어머니와 형제"

translation.en: She was, um, just really sweet and lovable and…
-She loved dressing up and-- -Yes, she… She did love to do that.
translation.ko: - 꾸미는 걸 좋아했죠 - 맞아, 꾸미는 걸 좋아했지

translation.en: But a little bit later, um, it just changed.
-[David] She got rebellious. -[Sharon] Yes, got rebellious. Yeah.
She was just having a hard time.
[sniffs] We didn't know, really, what to do.
On the fourth week, they go on a four-day solo period.
translation.ko: 넷째 주에는 나흘간 솔로 기간을 가져요

translation.en: All the drugs are out of their system.
They wanna go home and be sons and daughters to their parents again,
translation.ko: 아이들은 집으로 돌아가 다시 부모님의 아들딸로 살며

translation.en: and get an education.
[sniffs] It's just, you know… You think it's gonna help.
translation.ko: 그냥, 뭐랄까 도움이 될 것 같았어요

translation.en: [Max] I grew up in a ranching family in the harsh desert country here.
translation.ko: 전 이 혹독한 사막에서 목장을 운영하는 집에서 자랐어요

translation.en: People that were raised in this area
translation.ko: 이 지역에서 자란 사람들은 잘 알 거예요

translation.en: know and understand how harsh the desert can be.
translation.ko: 이 지역에서 자란 사람들은 잘 알 거예요 사막이 얼마나 혹독한지

translation.en: You're out between water holes, which may be ten miles apart.
The staff didn't have a lot of training.
translation.ko: 캠프 직원들은 훈련을 많이 받지 않았어요

translation.en: Some of them were former Challenger participants.
It became clear to me that it was a recipe for disaster.
translation.ko: 대참사가 벌어지는 건 불 보듯 뻔한 일이었어요

translation.en: [reporter] Officers from the Kane County Sheriff's Department
raided the Challenger Foundation's offices today.
It's those records officials hope will help them decide
translation.ko: 경관들은 이 자료들이 재단에 적용할 혐의를 결정하는 데

translation.en: what charges to file against the foundation.
translation.ko: 경관들은 이 자료들이 재단에 적용할 혐의를 결정하는 데 도움이 되기를 기대하고 있습니다

translation.en: [Max] At that point in time, I said, "I'm gonna get to the bottom of this,
translation.ko: 전 당시에 이렇게 말했어요 '이 사건의 진상을 규명하고 조치를 취하겠습니다'

translation.en: and we're gonna do something about this."
[reporter] Max Jackson is the sheriff of Kane County, where Challenger is located.
translation.ko: 챌린저가 위치한 케인 카운티의 보안관 맥스 잭슨은

translation.en: He says he's been flooded with complaints from parents across the country.
This case absolutely took over my life.
translation.ko: 이 사건은 내 삶을 송두리째 앗아갔어요

translation.en: As long as they're out there, law enforcement is gonna stay busy.
translation.ko: 저들이 저기에 있는 한 보안관은 바쁘게 움직일 겁니다

translation.en: [Steve] Kane County officials have just decided that they're going to destroy me.
translation.ko: 케인 카운티 당국은 절 무너뜨리기로 작정했어요

translation.en: If they can't get to me personally, they're gonna do it through the program.
translation.ko: 절 개인적으로 건드릴 수 없다면 프로그램을 통해 할 겁니다

translation.en: You send someone out in the desert, and they fall down,
translation.ko: 사막에 사람을 내보내고 그 사람이 쓰러져서 열사병 징후를 보이면 치료해야죠

translation.en: and they're exhibiting signs of heat exhaustion, you treat it.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 쓰러져서 열사병 징후를 보이면 치료해야죠

translation.en: Pioneers not only blaze the trail, but they get the arrows.
translation.ko: 개척자들은 새로운 길을 열며 화살을 맞기도 하죠

translation.en: I'm such an outspoken advocate for these programs.
I've seen so many lives changed, so many parents that are so grateful,
translation.ko: 너무 많은 삶이 달라지는 걸 봤고 수많은 부모님이 고마워하죠

translation.en: that I refuse to allow a bunch of petty bureaucrats to come in and dictate
translation.ko: 아무것도 모르는 공무원들이 이래라저래라 하게 둘 순 없어요

translation.en: when they don't even take the time to come and look around.
There's a great potential out there for, uh, more abuse and possibly another death.
translation.ko: 더 많은 학대와 또 다른 죽음이 일어날 가능성이 큽니다

translation.en: [reporter] Kane County officials charged Cartisano and the Challenger Foundation
translation.ko: 케인 카운티 당국은 카티사노와 챌린저 재단을

translation.en: with negligent homicide.
[man] If Steve got convicted, he was going to jail.
translation.ko: 유죄 판결을 받으면 스티브는 감옥에 가는 거였어요

translation.en: There was no question about it.
And he… he wasn't gonna do well in jail, so he was very worried.
translation.ko: 스티브는 감옥 생활에 자신이 없다며 많이 걱정했어요 "찰스 브로프만 스티브의 변호사"

translation.en: Because he knew if he lost the trial, he would be going to prison
translation.ko: 스티브는 알았거든요 재판에서 지면 자기는 감옥에 가고

translation.en: and would be leaving a young mother with four small children.
translation.ko: 어린 엄마가 네 아이를 혼자 키워야 한다는 걸요

translation.en: How you doing?
We're anticipating a lot of mud being thrown up against the wall,
translation.ko: 저희는 많은 비난이 쏟아질 걸 예상하고 있고

translation.en: and we're ready for it.
They just wanted him toasted.
[reporter 1] Eight other Challenger children say they were hit,
translation.ko: 챌린저 캠프에 참가한 다른 8명의 아이는 프로그램 감독관이 때리고 굶기고 나무에 묶었다고 진술했습니다

translation.en: starved, and tied to trees by program supervisors.
translation.ko: 프로그램 감독관이 때리고 굶기고 나무에 묶었다고 진술했습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Nine counts of child abuse have now also been leveled
translation.ko: 아이들을 나무에 묶는 것부터 돌바닥에 눕혀 끌고 다니는 것까지

translation.en: against the Challenger Foundation, from tying kids to trees
translation.ko: 아이들을 나무에 묶는 것부터 돌바닥에 눕혀 끌고 다니는 것까지 현재 챌린저 재단을 상대로

translation.en: to literally dragging them across the rocky ground.
Lawsuits.
Lawsuits, lawsuits, lawsuits start piling up.
[reporter] The lawsuits have generated considerable nationwide negative publicity.
translation.ko: 잇따른 소송은 전국적으로 부정적인 여론을 일으켰습니다

translation.en: Challenger officials say they have cost the program millions of dollars.
translation.ko: 챌린저 관계자는 이 프로그램에 수백만 달러가 든다고 말했죠

translation.en: Challenger cost families up to $16,000.
translation.ko: 챌린저는 아이 가족에게 최대 1만 6천 달러를 받았어요

translation.en: But one of Cartisano's core funding streams
translation.ko: 하지만 카티사노의 핵심 자금줄 중 하나는

translation.en: was billing insurance companies of the parents
for the kids' "treatment."
Suddenly the insurance companies are wanting to claw it back
translation.ko: 갑자기 보험사들은 지급한 비용을 회수하려 했죠

translation.en: because they're seeing the news coverage, and they're like, "Wait a sec."
translation.ko: 뉴스 보도를 보고 알게 된 거예요

translation.en: I feel very strongly about it because I know a lot of other kids
translation.ko: 제 생각은 확고해요 이 프로그램에서 학대당한 애들이 많거든요

translation.en: have been abused in the programs. I don't think it should happen anymore.
translation.ko: 이 프로그램에서 학대당한 애들이 많거든요 더는 이런 일이 있어서는 안 돼요

translation.en: The program was shut down.
Uh, we had no income. I went to work at Sears.
And so then we spent the next, uh, year and a half to two years
basically fighting the court case.
[reporter] Prosecutors once again tried to establish Cartisano was more concerned with profits
translation.ko: 검찰은 카티사노가 도와야 할 청소년들의 안전보다

translation.en: than with the safety of the troubled teens he was supposed to be helping.
translation.ko: 자신의 이익에 더 관심이 있었음을 다시 한번 입증하려 했습니다

translation.en: These guys have been lying for two years. They have lied.
They are the most deceitful group of people I've ever run into.
[Charles] Their case was Kristen Chase was hiked too hard
translation.ko: 이건 크리스틴 체이스가 무리한 하이킹을 하다가

translation.en: and died of exertional heatstroke.
The findings of the autopsy
found her internal organs
to be somewhat consistent with exertional heatstroke,
translation.ko: 운동성 열사병으로 볼 수 있는 징후들이 발견됐어요

translation.en: but it's also consistent with other causes of death.
translation.ko: 하지만 동시에 다른 사망 원인의 징후일 수도 있었죠

translation.en: And that's all I had to show. It was not exertional heatstroke.
translation.ko: 전 그걸 입증하면 됐어요 열사병이 아니란 걸 입증하면 살인 혐의를 벗을 수 있었죠

translation.en: That would have knocked out the homicide count.
translation.ko: 열사병이 아니란 걸 입증하면 살인 혐의를 벗을 수 있었죠

translation.en: I'm not a doctor, but, uh, she was taken up here to the high desert
translation.ko: 전 의사는 아니지만 크리스틴은 사막 고지대로 끌려왔어요

translation.en: by 6,000 feet, 100-degree temperature,
out of shape, and forced to march.
translation.ko: 몸 상태가 안 좋았지만 강제로 행군해야 했어요

translation.en: I do believe that he was negligent,
and that negligence led to Kristen Chase's death.
translation.ko: 그로 인해 크리스틴 체이스가 사망했다고 생각합니다

translation.en: [Horsehair] We were successful in what we did do.
He made his bed, I made my bed, and we both are in that.
translation.ko: 저와 스티브는 우리가 한 행동에 책임을 졌죠

translation.en: There are, as I understand it, Mr. Cartisano,
criminal charges now lodged against you for negligent homicide.
translation.ko: 현재 과실 치사 혐의로 형사 고발을 당하셨죠?

translation.en: That's right.
Was your Challenger Foundation responsible for the death of Kristen Chase?
translation.ko: 당신의 챌린저 재단은 크리스틴 체이스의 죽음에 책임이 있습니까?

translation.en: I didn't know Kristen. I was 500 miles away when she collapsed, at our office--
translation.ko: 전 크리스틴을 몰랐어요 쓰러졌을 때 전 800km 밖에…

translation.en: But in the case of Kristen, in the nine cases of child abuse,
translation.ko: 하지만 크리스틴 사건과 9건의 아동 학대 혐의

translation.en: in the various lawsuits filed against you, in the IRS action against you--
translation.ko: 걸려 있는 여러 소송과 국세청의 제재까지

translation.en: There's this inference here--
[Geraldo] You have a great calm attitude
for a man that seems to be facing the world ending on you.
translation.ko: 세상이 끝날 위기에 처한 사람치고는 정말 침착하시네요

translation.en: [Chris] On the day of the verdict,
the judge sends the jury out to deliberate.
It was really not looking good for Steve Cartisano.
The conditions in which she died
strongly indicated that she had been forced to hike
translation.ko: 타는 듯한 더위에 물도 먹지 못하고

translation.en: without water in blistering heat.
translation.ko: 하이킹을 할 수밖에 없었다는 게 명확하게 드러나거든요

translation.en: [Charles] They went out in the morning,
and they didn't come back with a verdict until that night.
The odds were stacked against him
because he had to prove in court that that was an accident.
translation.ko: 그게 사고였다는 걸 법정에서 증명해야 했으니까요

translation.en: Jury comes in, and the judge asks, "How do you find on this count?"
"Not guilty, not guilty, not guilty, not guilty."
We get out. You know, it was very, very exciting.
The mistake that defense lawyers make sometimes
is they try to prove an alternative theory of the case.
translation.ko: 사건의 대안적 이론을 증명하려고 하는 거예요

translation.en: That's a mistake.
You just have to show
that the prosecutor's theory of the case is wrong.
We don't know for sure what she died from.
translation.ko: 우린 크리스틴이 왜 죽었는지 확실히 몰라요

translation.en: We speculate it could've been toxic shock syndrome.
We speculate it could've been septic shock.
It was not exertional heatstroke,
or at least there is reasonable doubt.
It was just a huge relief.
Relief beyond description.
It had to end, and that's… And that's what I wanted.
translation.ko: 이것은 끝나야 했고 그게 제가 원한 것입니다

translation.en: After two years, this had to stop, and I'm glad it's over.
translation.ko: 2년이 지났고 멈춰야 했어요 드디어 끝나서 기쁩니다

translation.en: We felt it was an answer to prayer.
Just disbelief. Still. [sniffs]
-What, is it 32 years later? -Mm-hmm.
[Sharon] We really miss her.
A lot. [cries]
Nobody had responsibility over that. It's something that happened.
translation.ko: 그 일은 누구의 책임도 아니었어요 그냥 벌어진 일이죠

translation.en: I don't know if that sounds cold or not, but it's reality.
[Debbie] We didn't want any more publicity.
We didn't want any more of the stress and strain.
I was worried about my children and its effects on them,
translation.ko: 전 아이들이 걱정됐어요 아이들에게 미칠 영향이 걱정됐죠

translation.en: and I wanted him to quit doing youth programs.
translation.ko: 전 아이들이 걱정됐어요 아이들에게 미칠 영향이 걱정됐죠 스티브가 청소년 프로그램을 그만뒀으면 했어요

translation.en: But it was like he really didn't know what else he could do.
translation.ko: 그런데 스티브는 달리 뭘 해야 할지 몰랐죠

translation.en: And I've been able to overcome that. So can you.
[Debbie] This is Steve when he was maybe four or five years old.
translation.ko: 이건 스티브가 네다섯 살 때쯤일 거예요

translation.en: That's Inez.
[Debbie] When he was a baby,
he was initially given up by his father and mother,
and he was adopted by a couple named Troy and Inez.
She was devastated
when his natural mother and father took him back
at about two years old, I think.
[interviewer] What's your background and your training for this?
translation.ko: 이 일에 관한 경력이나 훈련받은 게 있으신가요?

translation.en: It varies. I'm a graduate of the School of Hard Knocks mostly,
translation.ko: 다양하죠 전 대부분 삶의 역경에서 배웠어요

translation.en: just where I've come from and my own life.
My mother was a heroin addict, spent time in prison.
translation.ko: 제 어머니는 헤로인 중독자였고 감옥에 들어가셨어요

translation.en: She was killed when I was 17.
My father, he had a pretty hot temper.
His way of handling problems was to smack you around.
translation.ko: 두드려 패는 게 아버지의 문제 해결 방식이었죠

translation.en: He struggled through junior high and high school.
translation.ko: 중학생과 고등학생 시절을 정말 힘들게 보냈어요

translation.en: It wasn't easy.
He didn't really wanna go into his dad's concrete business,
translation.ko: 스티브는 아버지의 콘크리트 회사에 들어가기 싫어서

translation.en: so he joined the Air Force.
It changed his life and made him become the confident person that he became.
translation.ko: 그게 스티브의 인생을 바꿨죠 거기서 자신감을 얻었어요

translation.en: The combination of the boot training and the survival experience
and all the things that he experienced in the Air Force,
those things helped him mature and become a more responsible person.
translation.ko: 스티브는 좀 더 책임감 있는 성숙한 사람이 됐어요

translation.en: And so he really believed that it was a good way to help young people
translation.ko: 그래서 스티브는 그게 아이들이 자신감을 쌓고

translation.en: that would build their self-confidence and help them make better choices in life.
translation.ko: 삶에서 더 나은 선택을 하게 돕는 좋은 방법이라고 믿었죠

translation.en: [Debbie] But now that the court case was over, he'd been acquitted,
translation.ko: 하지만 이제 재판은 끝났고 무죄 판결을 받았으니

translation.en: I wanted him to find some other way to help provide for the family.
translation.ko: 전 스티브가 가족을 부양할 다른 방법을 찾았으면 했어요

translation.en: -[interviewer] And did he? -[Debbie] No.
No.
The rate of violent crimes by juveniles in the United States jumped more than 25%
translation.ko: 미국 청소년의 폭력 범죄율은 지난 10년간 25% 이상 급증했습니다

translation.en: in the last decade.
[sheriff] I smell marijuana. My nose don't lie.
translation.ko: 마리화나 냄새가 나네 내 코는 거짓말 안 해

translation.en: Once you got into the '90s, parents were still struggling with,
"What do I do with this kid?"
It seems to be definitely true. Kids are smoking a lot of pot.
translation.ko: 확실한 사실 같네요 아이들은 대마초를 많이 피웁니다

translation.en: Maybe as much as they did back in the old days.
[Debbie] Steve knew that wilderness programs
could still help so many families,
translation.ko: 여전히 많은 가족을 도울 수 있다고 생각했어요

translation.en: but everywhere he tried to go,
the social services department would shut him down.
He has basically been blacklisted.
But Cartisano, I think, took pleasure
from always being able to outsmart the authorities
translation.ko: 당국을 한 수 앞서 따돌리고 자신을 아무도 모르는 곳에서

translation.en: and respin it in the next location where nobody knows his name.
translation.ko: 새 프로그램을 시작하는 걸 즐긴 것 같아요

translation.en: Hi, guys. How ya doing? I knew you'd be here.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요, 잘 지냈어요? 와 계실 줄 알았어요

translation.en: So, eventually, he went to the Virgin Islands.
I believe on Saint Thomas.
[Chris] As a reporter, I'm like, "I'm gonna try to catch you."
"I'm gonna try," because the courts weren't doing anything.
translation.ko: 저라도 나서야 했죠 법정은 아무것도 안 했으니까요

translation.en: The only court we had was the court of public opinion.
translation.ko: 우리가 가진 유일한 법정은 여론 재판뿐이었어요

translation.en: You turn one rock over,
there's another rock to turn over underneath that.
translation.ko: 그 밑에 뒤집을 돌이 또 나오죠

translation.en: "Stephen Cartisano, whose Challenger Utah Wilderness Therapy Program was outlawed
after a girl under his care died in the desert
translation.ko: '유타주의 야생 치료 프로그램을 운영한 스티브 카티사노가'

translation.en: is back in business."
"Now, he's running a program known as Health Care America."
translation.ko: "1993년 11월 21일, 일요일" '현재 그는 헬스 케어 아메리카란 프로그램을 운영 중이다'

translation.en: He's still doing it.
[Debbie] When we first met, he was studying film, actually,
translation.ko: 우리가 처음 만났을 때 그이는 영화 공부를 하고 있었어요

translation.ko: 그래서 스티브는 그 경력을 활용해 홍보 영상 제작을 도왔죠

translation.en: [Chris] He created a really nice, well-produced video with actors.
translation.ko: 스티브는 배우들과 함께 아주 멋진 홍보 영상을 만들었어요

translation.en: [woman] Usually, the kind of rebellion you get the first few days
is a real subtle rebellion, if you will.
They're, uh, just kind of slow.
They drag their feet. They just don't wanna make it go smoothly.
Instead of hiking, this was putting kids on boats, I remember?
Right? That's what it was.
[boy] Hey, what are you doing?
-Hey, calm down, Dan. -You take the ****.
-What are you doing? Huh? -Dan!
I was like, "Wait."
Undeterred from the fact he just got acquitted
for negligent homicide of a 16-year-old girl in his care,
translation.ko: 과실 치사 혐의를 벗은 지 얼마 되지도 않았는데

translation.en: he did what? You're kidding, right?
[man] Dan!
[woman] Naturally, in a program of this nature,
there are gonna be kids that are more aggressive than others.
translation.ko: 좀 더 공격적인 아이들이 있기 마련이죠

translation.en: Dan, in particular, was one that was very aggressive.
Steve just takes it to the next level and says, "I'm gonna charge even more."
translation.ko: 스티브는 한 단계 더 나아가서 프로그램 비용을 높였어요

translation.en: The concept had morphed from the stark Utah desert
translation.ko: 그리고 콘셉트를 바꿨죠 황량한 유타 사막에서 생존 기술을 배우는 것에서

translation.en: and learning survival skills
translation.ko: 황량한 유타 사막에서 생존 기술을 배우는 것에서

translation.en: to a little more like a pleasure cruise in the Caribbean.
[Steve] I'll watch ya. I'll help ya. But I'm not gonna do it for ya.
translation.ko: 내가 지켜보고 도와줄게 하지만 내가 해 주진 않을 거야

translation.en: If you don't put it together right, you have to suffer with it.
translation.ko: 제대로 안 하면 고생하는 건 너야

translation.en: [Chris] They may land and anchor somewhere,
